text.*:
The Ebb and Flow of the Ages

Chapter Info

Volume:

110

Chapter:

1121

Japanese Title:

時代のうねり

Romanized Title:

Jidai no Uneri

Viz Title:

The Upheaval of the Era

Pages:

17

Release Date:

July 22, 2024

WSJ Issue:

2024 Issue 34
Chapter Chronology
← Previous Next →
Chapter 1121 is titled "The Ebb and Flow of the Ages".

Contents

  • 1 Cover Page
  • 2 Short Summary
  • 3 Long Summary
  • 4 Quick References
    • 4.1 Chapter Notes
    • 4.2 Characters
  • 5 Author Comment
  • 6 Trivia
  • 7 References
  • 8 Arc Navigation

Cover Page[]

Color Spread: The Straw Hats enjoying summer treats and activities around a giant Nami.

Short Summary[]

As the Giant Warrior Pirates defend against Saturn, Bonney regains her Nika form, she and Luffy knock away Saturn. As Dr. Vegapunk's message continues, he mentions on how history and fate are tied to elimination of the few living descendants of rare species. He believes that people should be to take care of themselves as they would head towards a new era. As the Thousand Sunny is landing towards the sea, Vegapunk believes the fate of the world is tied to whoever gets the One Piece.

Long Summary[]

The Giant Warrior Pirates defend against Saturn's onslaught, and Luffy readies another attack but stops when he sees Bonney has recovered and turned back into her Gear 5 imitation. He instead deflects one of Saturn's legs aiming for her. When she gets in the air, Luffy tells her to attack him herself. Meanwhile, Dr. Vegapunk tells the world that the day the history of the Void Century will come and reiterates how once again the continents of the world were sunk by the Ancient Weapons of the past. He also declares that someone is trying to erase the descendants of the rare races, such as the Buccaneers, Lunarians, and Three-Eye Tribe.

Bonney yells to Saturn that she wants to settle the score with him as Luffy continues to block his attacks. With the memories of Saturn's cruelty to both Kuma and Ginny flowing through her mind, Bonney angrily and tearfully denounces Saturn and the rest of the Five Elders as gods, but she states that gods and heroes do exist, and although she dearly wanted to live with her parents as a family, she is going to honor their wishes to keep on living. Together, Bonney and Luffy unleash simultaneous attacks on Saturn, which were powerful enough to blast Saturn to pieces and send him falling toward the ocean, with everyone cheering and Kuma smiling. Everyone then notices the Thousand Sunny falling out of the sky.

Vegapunk tells the world that the people who have resisted the oppression of the World Government for so long are, ironically enough, the ones who are close to figuring out the truth, and that Roger was hoping for this the day he died and announced his treasure was up for grabs. Vegapunk's words rile up people all over the world, with pirates on Hachinosu hoping Blackbeard returns soon so they can go and find it. Meanwhile, the people of Cross Guild come to admire and respect Buggy even more because they assume he was with the rest of the crew when they discovered the true history, unaware he did not go because he was sick that day. Even the Marines wish to find it, only to be reminded the safety of the people comes first. Regardless, Vegapunk admits that the person who finds the One Piece may not be who Joy Boy wanted, but there is no stopping its discovery, for the fate of the world rests in who finds it.

Quick References[]

Chapter Notes[]

  • Luffy and Bonney manage to repel Saturn away from the Giant Warrior Pirates' ship.
  • The Thousand Sunny is about to land at sea.
  • King is revealed to be alive after his and Queen's battle with Admiral Ryokugyu and is in an unknown location.
  • In his broadcast, Vegapunk declares that the fate of the world will be decided by whoever claims the One Piece.
    • The chapter shows the primary candidates to finding the One Piece as the current Four Emperors, Sakazuki, Koby, Imu, Kuzan, Sabo, Monkey D. Dragon, Figarland Garling, and a silhouetted figure wielding a sword.

Author Comment[]


Author Comment
  • Translation
  • Original


Went to a Summers performance for the first time in forever! I laughed so hard, all my daily stress was blasted away!


久しぶりのさまぁ～ずライブ!!日頃のストレス全部吹き飛ぶ程笑ってきました!!

—Eiichiro Oda
English translation by VIZ Media. For comprehensive translation credits, see here.


Trivia[]

  • The title of the chapter is a reference to a quote from Gol D. Roger in Chapter 100, where he listed three things that "cannot be stopped": Inherited will, people's dreams, and the ebb and flow of the ages.
    • The other two have previously been used as the titles of Chapter 145 and Chapter 225.
  • Originally, the cover page of this chapter was going to be a picture of the Straw Hats making a small model of the Going Merry together, but Eiichiro Oda changed to a picture of Nami halfway through.[1]

References[]

  1. ↑ https://x.com/Eiichiro_Staff/status/1814857928064835870

'''Chapter 1121''' is titled "The Ebb and Flow of the Ages". 

==Cover Page==
[[Cover Page#Color Spread|Color Spread]]: The Straw Hats enjoying summer treats and activities around a giant Nami.

==Short Summary==
As the [[Giant Warrior Pirates]] defend against [[Jaygarcia Saturn|Saturn]], [[Jewelry Bonney|Bonney]] regains her [[Nika]] form, she and [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] knock away Saturn. As [[Vegapunk|Dr. Vegapunk]]'s message continues, he mentions on how history and fate are tied to elimination of the few living descendants of rare species. He believes that people should be to take care of themselves as they would head towards a new era. As the [[Thousand Sunny]] is landing towards the sea, Vegapunk believes the fate of the world is tied to whoever gets the [[One Piece]].

==Long Summary==
The [[Giant Warrior Pirates]] defend against [[Jaygarcia Saturn|Saturn's]] onslaught, and [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] readies another attack but stops when he sees [[Jewelry Bonney|Bonney]] has recovered and turned back into her [[Gomu Gomu no Mi/Gear 5 Techniques|Gear 5]] imitation. He instead deflects one of Saturn's legs aiming for her. When she gets in the air, Luffy tells her to attack him herself. Meanwhile, [[Vegapunk|Dr. Vegapunk]] tells the world that the day the history of the [[Void Century]] will come and reiterates how once again the continents of the world were sunk by the [[Ancient Weapons]] of the past. He also declares that someone is trying to erase the descendants of the rare races, such as the [[Buccaneers]], [[Lunarians]], and [[Three-Eye Tribe]].

Bonney yells to Saturn that she wants to settle the score with him as Luffy continues to block his attacks. With the memories of Saturn's cruelty to both [[Bartholomew Kuma|Kuma]] and [[Ginny]] flowing through her mind, Bonney angrily and tearfully denounces Saturn and the rest of the [[Five Elders]] as gods, but she states that gods and heroes do exist, and although she dearly wanted to live with her parents as a family, she is going to honor their wishes to keep on living. Together, Bonney and Luffy unleash simultaneous attacks on Saturn, which were powerful enough to blast Saturn to pieces and send him falling toward the ocean, with everyone cheering and Kuma smiling. Everyone then notices the [[Thousand Sunny]] falling out of the sky.

Vegapunk tells the world that the people who have resisted the oppression of the [[World Government]] for so long are, ironically enough, the ones who are close to figuring out the truth, and that [[Gol D. Roger|Roger]] was hoping for this the day he died and announced his treasure was up for grabs. Vegapunk's words rile up people all over the world, with pirates on [[Hachinosu]] hoping [[Marshall D. Teach|Blackbeard]] returns soon so they can go and find it. Meanwhile, the people of [[Cross Guild]] come to admire and respect [[Buggy]] even more because they assume he was with the rest of the crew when they discovered the true history, unaware he did not go because he was sick that day. Even the [[Marines]] wish to find it, only to be reminded the safety of the people comes first. Regardless, Vegapunk admits that the person who finds the [[One Piece]] may not be who [[Joy Boy]] wanted, but there is no stopping its discovery, for the fate of the [[world]] rests in who finds it.

==Quick References==
===Chapter Notes===
*[[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] and [[Jewelry Bonney|Bonney]] manage to repel [[Jaygarcia Saturn|Saturn]] away from the [[Giant Warrior Pirates]]' ship.
*The [[Thousand Sunny]] is about to land at sea.
*[[King]] is revealed to be alive after his and [[Queen|Queen's]] battle with [[Aramaki|Admiral Ryokugyu]] and is in an unknown location.
*In his broadcast, [[Vegapunk]] declares that the fate of the [[world]] will be decided by whoever claims the [[One Piece]].
**The chapter shows the primary candidates to finding the One Piece as the current [[Four Emperors]], [[Sakazuki]], [[Koby]], [[Imu]], [[Kuzan]], [[Sabo]], [[Monkey D. Dragon]], [[Figarland Garling]], and a [[Figarland Shamrock|silhouetted figure wielding a sword]].

==Trivia==
*The title of the chapter is a reference to a quote from [[Gol D. Roger]] in [[Chapter 100]], where he listed three things that "cannot be stopped": [[Inherited Will|Inherited will]], people's dreams, and the ebb and flow of the ages.
**The other two have previously been used as the titles of [[Chapter 145]] and [[Chapter 225]].
*Originally, the cover page of this chapter was going to be a picture of the [[Straw Hat Pirates|Straw Hats]] making a small model of the [[Going Merry]] together, but [[Eiichiro Oda]] changed to a picture of Nami halfway through.<ref>https://x.com/Eiichiro_Staff/status/1814857928064835870</ref>
